article.headline: Cal Poly-SLO 79, UC Davis 67
article.story: SAN LUIS OBISPO, Calif. (AP) -- Senior forward Dreshawn Vance had 19 points including seven dunks as Cal Poly defeated UC Davis 79-67 Thursday night. Junior guards Chaz Thomas and Trae Clark each added 16 points while sophomore guard Lorenzo Keeler contributed 10 points as the Mustangs snapped a three-game losing streak and improved to 7-11 for the season and 2-4 in Big West games. Cal Poly had lost four of its last five games overall and three of its last four home contests. UC Davis, officially in the Big West for the first season, fell to 8-11 and 2-4. The Aggies were led by sophomore guard Shane Hanson with 19 points and eight rebounds. UC Davis never trailed the first half, building seven-point leads five times. The Mustangs caught the Aggies at the buzzer, 33-33, on a three-pointer by Thomas, capping an 11-4 run. But UC Davis went back on top early in the second half, opening up a 51-42 advantage with 12:30 to go on a three-pointer by Hanson. One of Vance's seven dunks ignited Cal Poly as the Mustangs went on a 28-5 run.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
